trends: There has been one other sighting in Orangeville
There were no other sightings in Orangeville on or around August 5th 2007
divs: sighting detailsbecause of the sighting i had a few nights ago, i'm struggling to not sit outside at night and watch the evening sky. my 5 month old puppy got this really strange growling sound about her, and started running up and down the fence line, which alerted my attention. i saw the same damn thing tonight. and again... my puppy scrambled for the back door to let her in. it was identical to the previous sighting of the other night. unfortunately... my previous report reads that it was traveling sw, which is incorrect. i was so shook up, that i meant to say it was traveling south east! i also meant to say in my previous report that the full moon was also located in the south east, not sw. again, i will say it was 5 lights in a triangle formation. this time i truly observed that it was just above the tree tops, not 1\2 a tree higher like i reported before. again, the size of the lights do not conform to my aviation knowledge. again, there wasn't a sound to be heard. what i (thought) i noticed the other night was that there was no cricket noises. but i couldn't be certain. tonight... there was cricket noises, then they all stopped... that's when my puppy acted strange. tonight i truly paid attention to that fact, that when the object crossed my path, all was silent, crickets and all. i would also like to add that back in the 80's i lived on a usaf base, and my ex was an air traffic controller. plus, considering my past work history of working for an aviation based company... i'm still struggling to figure out a reasonable explantion. it was traveling the same path i witnessed the other night. it was traveling south east!!! not sw as i reported a few days ago. to me, the biggest factor is the lack of noise!!!!
